messages.content:
**HIP 77: Launch Parameters for Solana Migration**
Author: @n_ , @hashc0de 
Start Date: 2023-02-20
Category: Technical
Original HIP PR: https://github.com/helium/HIP/issues/570
Tracking Issue: HIP 77: https://github.com/helium/HIP/issues/573

**Summary**
In the course of the migration to the Solana blockchain and prior to the finality date of
2023-03-27, several parameters need to be finalized by the community. This includes everything from
governance settings, circuit breaker settings, and the number of decimals in our tokens to prevent
overflow.

The largest change proposed here is to change MOBILE and IOT tokens from 8 decimals to 6 decimals.
Solana uses the u64 data type to represent token supply, and given the hundreds of billions of
tokens in MOBILE and IOT, with 8 decimals, this would cause an overflow.

The second largest change is the formation of a multisig to govern the helium programs and
parameters. Currently, changes to the blockchain are governed by a master key that flips a chainvar
after validators have upgraded. On Solana, programs are upgradeable by an updated authority.

**Motivation**
HIP-70 proposed a move to Solana to scale the helium network. Now that the implementation of this
The HIP is well underway, we should finalize the settings for when we move to the Solana network. While
most of these settings can be changed, it is important we reach consensus before flipping the
switch.

**Rendered View**
https://github.com/helium/HIP/blob/main/0077-solana-parameters.md

messages.content: Pinned a message.

And the HIP assembly line keeps moving on 😀 .

Small detail: didn't HIP 75 change the MOBILE max supply to 200bln tokens?
(First screenshot: HIP 77, second one is HIP 75).
The app will have HNT (mined from befre the transition) and then IOT? or the HNT will be changed to IOT/MOBILE?

I think the wallet app will have all of these tokens, as HNT is *not* going away. After all, after the full impplementation of the treasuries, one will be able to redeem IOT and MOBILE for HNT and you need to keep it somewhere. If a wallet has HNT before the transition, the same amount will be in the wallet after transition. But hotspots will stop earning HNT at some point in time and earn IOT instead. (MOBILE hotspots already earn MOBILE tokens). Does that answer your question or did I get it wrong?
Ok but the poc hnt mined will not be exchanged to iot right?

I have a very long-term perspective question: 
The emissions schedules of IOT and of MOBILE have perpetual halvings and - unlike HNT - no net emissions. If these emissions schedules aren't changed in any way, and the amount of decimals won't be changed, some time in the (admittedly very distant future), there won't be enough granularity to do proper token accounting, right? Reducing the decimals from 8 to 6 has the consequence of this happening earlier.
I'd like to know if there are already any thoughts how this issue will be addressed then. 
Do we expect to be able to just add more decimals then (bc maybe Solana or whatever L1 we're on then will *then* in all likelihood allow bigger numbers) or does anyone already has a rough idea of a modification of the subDAO token emissions schedule that would render that issue non-existent? (Or - third option - am I getting something completely wrong here, if so, what?)

As far as I know (I am quite certain here): each and every HNT - no matter its origin - will continue to be HNT.
What will change: before the transition/subDAO implementation, PoC mining is rewarded with HNT - after a specific point in time, it is rewarded with IOT. HNT stays HNT.
Does that help?

..........................
I am confused by the term "wallet-owning bones". Maybe I don't get it bc I am a non-native speaker?
sorry, maybe not reading this right. if you have HNT in your wallet, it will still be HNT post-migration
i am guessing the `-` is erroneous here
Possibly? I hope the native English  speakers will clear this up.
ok. so the app will have the hnt from pre transition and then a diff wallet for the newly IOT / MOBILE (coming from mining post transition)
it's unclear, agreed. 1 HNT consists of 1e8 bones
but 1 MOBILE also consists of 1e8 bones albeit MOBILE bones
Mining under the Genesis phase has started. MOBILE cannot be redeemed for HNT until HIP51 Phase 2 and the introduction of the MOBILE Treasury which will be ~Q1 2023.
they will all be in the same wallet, as they are today

I was thinking whether it would be a good idea to have specific names for each type of bones to avoid confusion, like you suggested," MOBILE bones", "IOT bones", "HNT bones" as a fixed term, instead of just saying "bones".  (Or "MOBILE-bones", "IOT-bones", "HNT-bones").
Or you are talking about something else here?
no, you're right, but I have so many changes proposed that I'm building a PR

Shouldn't be something like:
> - The Helium Foundation Multisig
> - Any holder with more than 30m veHNT
?

Also:
Will holders with less than 30m veHNT each be able to pool their veHNT to  get above the 30m veHNT threshold?
that's wrong too, it's not 2 entities, it's _any_ entity having 30M veHNT _or_ Foundation
That's the way I understood/meant it. Obviously my suggestion wasn't clear either.
oh sorry, I didn't mean you were wrong, I meant the text was wrong

Do you read it as I do:
it is not suggested here, that entities with less than 30m veHNT can pool their veHNT to pass the 30m veHNT threshold. 
Or can a pool be an entity / a holder? (I'd suspect: no).
Sorry folks. Didn’t realize this was out of drafts yet. It needs some work.
@groot open to taking a PR. I’ll have look later today.

If there are no technical impossibilities, I believe we should keep the epoch duration as 30 minutes for IoT, as it is now. There is some “real PoC” there and immediate feedback about the rewards is nice to continue having.
Can we reconsider 24hr epochs?

In the HIP 20 HNT emissions and distribution schedule, the founders' rewards percentage decreases annually by 1 percentage point to a level of 15% and then stays at these 15% in all the years after that.
In the HIP 77 addendum, it annually decreases by 1% point until it eventually goes down to 0% and stays at 0%. 
Is that intentional or an excel-sheet copy and paste error?
Did I just ruin the option to stealth vote the founders' reward out of existence? 😅
you ever hear about not interrupting your 'enemy' when they are making a mistake? 😏
@Siegfried, want to proof my PR? <https://github.com/mawdegroot/helium-hip/blob/mg/clarify-77-01/0077-solana-parameters.md>

Last night's lack of sleep is catching up with me (it's late evening where I live), together with me not being used to work with github except for reading and commenting, I don't think I can contribute meaningfully - at least not before a really good night's sleep. 
Love the summary, especially the list of parameters and how you avoid using the word "bones".

First general impression (stopped reading after "decimals for IOT and MOBILE"): a lot of things appear easier to understand, although made no direct comparison with the "original" HIP 77 wordings. HIP 75 changed MOBILE max supply to 200bln, btw.
Thank you for your efforts regardless.

The Treasury Circuit Breaker Section should be removed. 
1) I have never been a fan of not having a treasury in place. this section essentially says we cannot convert rewards back to HNT for the first month
2) It is theoretically possilbe to have the treasury drained, that is the point. By only keeping a cap of 20% of its value per day, you are allowing the treasury to grow. At some point there may be a true mass exodus of the subDOA token which should be allowed to happen
I hope it doesn't happen but don't like the proposed governance behind it limiting it
it is an interesting question, if you are only allowed to take out 20% it will never be empty, it can get near empty but never completely empty.
but only after HNT stops flowing into it right?
can you rephrase that, I don't understand the question

I have to think about this one more myself. I guess my fear is the treasures are never going to stop growing but that is determained by the utility score and how much flows in. Just will be how much time it takes to drain if that is what the market dictates.
Actually I think you're right. If X is deposited every day and you withdraw the max every day you'll get to the point where the max you can withdraw is the same as the X eventually.

I have seen so many hip versions it’s tough to remember all the changes. I recall reading a planned transaction fee that the programmatic treasury would charge for converting DNT to HNT through the treasury. This nominal fee (0.3% I think) was supposed to stay in the treasury, so theoretically, the treasury should not go to zero HNT.
Please correct my understanding if this is wrong.
With the current parameters as proposed the treasury can’t go to 0 because you are only allowed to take out max 20% per day
Without a transaction fee, couldn’t it theoretically go to zero (I.e. to the level of significant digits that no longer matters)?
No, circuit breakers set at 20% means that as long as it keeps getting rewards added you can never get it even near zero
I think the 1 month lock needs to be removed as it seems redundant with the 20% max withdrawal limit

Definitely 1 month lock should be removed. You kill any redemption of new mint which people currently are free to do today. I could be persuaded with the CB but need some understanding on what resets that. It states the foundation will have control to act fast but just want to have a good understanding around what would happen and how long it would take to reset.
Whole day cutoffs could be too long.
Can it be possible to continue having 30 min epochs?
So the rewards will still be calculated on a shorter interval than 24 hours
And be able to be claimed on those intervals. That I think is staying 30 minutes. This is more for the token distribution, esp with respect to subdao treasuries
It’s just on the blockchain that we need to constrain calculations to discrete blocks of time
Can talk with the team and see if it’s possible to add a shorter rewards epoch as part of this HIP.
if the reward periods etc stay at 30 minutes the epoch is effectively 30 minutes, not 24h
Maybe we need different terminology
An epoch as far as token minting is concerned, and a reward epoch.
I actually liked the 24h reward epoch because it smooths out rewards. Epoch to epoch fluctuations are a serious thing at 30 minutes.

I agree with this, but a common counterpoint has been that identifying gaps in rewards (frequently used as a proxy for a gap in activity) allows Hotspot owners to mediate problems in their installs more quickly.
If you have activity to tell you that you don't need the rewards right?
oh absolutely! Its more that apps people are using report on rewards rather than activity, simple change there for most of them (ideally)
again to stress, I prefer 24 hr reward epochs, "limiting" a Hotspot to just 365 reward txns a day would be amazing for my accounting
I think that 24h reward epochs make for a much more stable reward units / DNT
Daily epochs could create arbitrage opportunities
how?

If there is significant price movement and you get paid for data based on the Oracle price you can have enough time to convert DNT to HNT, HNT to DC, recycle DC back to more DNT than you started with.  Shorter epochs defend against this.
Normally it would be a who cares situation because more HNT burn but if you manipulate the price of a DNT to encourages this behavior you start to affect the subDAO treasury funds
I need to think about this some more, I get your point but I'm not sure it is easily exploitable in this case.

It sounds like rewards are only claimable after the 24hr period? If so I feel like a longer period would make sense tbh. The reason is gaming, if the hotspot rewards are locked for 7 days - 14 days it'd give adequate time to process any gaming "audits". Also if found to be gaming would it be possible for the audit committee to "earn" said rewards vs the gamers?

Note that the Oracle Price used for DC burn reward payouts has not been precisely defined yet, but we have heard that it will be “reasonable” and based on market price of DNT, just like the current HNT Oracle Price, and not just treasury floor price. Among other things, this is necessary especially for MOBILE, whose treasury floor price in HNT will start at zero and rise gradually. If the price of MOBILE in HNT is zero, the number of MOBILE per HNT is infinity, and by orchestrating an episode of inflated data transfer, one could launch an “all your MOBILE are belong to us” attack, similar to what led to HIP-10.

I think a market-based  Oracle Price should prevent the arb you describe, considering DNTs are expected to trade above treasury floor price.

market based oracle price doesn’t prevent the arb because of the time lag between the time you pay for your data and the time you get your data back. What does make it hard(er) to arb is that you have 1 moment per 24h you get your rewards so you’d have to look further than the next few hours
Okay, so looked into it. to clarify, IOT and Mobile rewards are also set to be on a 24 hour interval.
So if we do or don't want that to happen, should discuss more here.
Fwiw I think 24h across the board makes sense. Smooths things out.
what's the concern with a 24h rewards interval?

I know @Tushar and Kyle have written about the arbitrage opportunities for a 24 hour reward interval with a BME.  I will defer to their judgement since they’ve thought through the issues with it whereas I’ve just read their text book and for this specific issue know as a rule, longer epochs are bad for BME
Yeah the problem is when the redemption price of a subdao token in hnt terms is higher than the market price on 3rd party trading venues
Creates an arbitrage where traders buy subdao token to redeem it
Smoothing creates this problem
Is there a way to mitigate this risk under a 24 hour epoch?
"problem" here is that you burn HNT to get DC and get rewarded DNT so it's at least 1 extra step
now that I think about it that only makes it more elaborate but not less fruitful
I thought the rewards calculations ensure that the value of DNT you receive is always less than or equal to the DC sent through the router?
Right not you get rewarded at most 1:1 in HNT what the DC burned is worth, but this is calculated at reward time (= end of epoch)

I think @Tushar is talking about arbitrage of the treasury redemption price vs a price on a 3rd party trading venue. Is this arb a problem though? The market should always be adjusting to what's in the treasury.
But the HNT -> DC conversion can occur at any time
So I burn `n` HNT to `x` DC. Use that and get back `m` IOT at the end of epoch which is now the equivalent of `1.1n` HNT.
And by having 24 hours to accomplish this arb you have time to do it before the oracle price changes.
I generally think the deflationary aspect of the arb isn’t a big deal since you can just redom tokens to 8 decimal places but adding in the treasury piece can throw off the DAO utility score piece
indeed, basically the free esims times an army
Can you plug it some actual numbers to better illustrate how this arb would work?  I’m assuming this situation is if HNT sold off significantly in the 24 hr period?
well, no, it was by design since we can't speculate here.

So the fundamental problem is in a hypothetical scenario where we’re 23 hours into a 24 hour block, the HNT -> DC conversion takes place at a stale conversion rate (23 hours old) but the DC -> MOBILE earnings take place at a current conversion rate (1 hour from now)?
that's the general idea yes

It seems like the first part is the whole issue then.  The HNT -> DC can’t use a stale (23 hour old) conversion rate.  That needs to be much more up to date for many reasons, not just this one particular arb.
the point is it isn't stale data at the moment of burn
So if we’re 12 hours into a 24 hour period, and I burn HNT to DC, is the conversation rate from 12 hours ago, right now, or 12 hours from now?
if you burn HNT to DC the conversion rate is from now
Ok, that seems as it should be.  I’m lost as to how the arb exists then?

In other words, if someone is converting HNT -> DC at the current price, even if they’re converting DC -> MOBILE at a future price a few hours from now, the best guess for that conversion price will also be the current price.  So where is the arb?  The only issue would be if you could convert either one, HNT -> DC or DC -> MOBILE at a past price.  Then that would be an arb opportunity.  But it doesn’t seem like that’s the case here unless I’m missing something?
But a 23 hour old treasury price may no longer be appropriate as we have new data. And if a trader can see what the price will change to when the clock strikes midnight they will try to frontrun that

Simple example:
- Treasury price from 23 hours ago is 1000 Mobile : 1 HNT and that’s where other trading venues are also pricing Mobile : HNT
- Based on data on chain we know that Mobile price in treasury is going to drop to 1100 Mobile : 1 HNT 
- Arbitragers will burn as much Mobile as possible to redeem for HNT via the treasury before the treasury price adjustment happens. Redemptions will deplete the treasury

I think my main question is can we interact or execute in any way on a price from 23 hours ago?  If so, then absolutely we need to fix that because that’ll create all sorts of arbitrage opportunities.

And just to clarify, if the “executing” is happening on a free trading exchange, then I don’t consider that an issue as exchanges can trade at whatever price they want and if they’re mispriced, then so be it.
The issue would be if the guaranteed HNT -> DC redemption or DC -> MOBILE rewarding was being awarded on a 23 hour old price, but I don’t think they are?

Thinking about this some more, I think the issue would be if we allowed MOBILE -> HNT treasury conversion to take place at the prior day’s conversion ratio.  That definitely is an issue, but can’t we solve it by having anyone who submits a subdao to HNT treasury conversion not get the HNT immediately, but rather at the close of the current 24 hour period at a conversion ratio that won’t be precisely known until the period ends?  Obviously people would prefer to know the exact ratio they’ll be getting when they submit the conversion, but knowing that is what creates the arbitrage opportunity.
This makes sense. I don’t think epoch length changes solve this.

You shouldn’t be able to convert MOBILE to HNT using the prior price (conversion ratio).  You should have to submit your conversion and then be awarded HNT at the next price.  Doesn’t that solve the issue?

agree. changing the epoch length to shorter and shorter intervals creates other technical constraints and with a fast enough contract and execution, you could potentially have the arbitrage at smaller intervals. "harder" but if there's a reason to do it, people will.
It’s a thing now, with 30 min intervals so you’re never going to get it short enough.
It will be a lot harder with shorter intervals though, so there is a tradeoff. As long as that tradeoff is understood and properly explained I don’t see the problem
i agree with n_'s point that "shorter intervals is not a solution (if there is a problem)"
sounds pretty tedious and potentially problematic once there is enough burn to no longer be 1:1

I'm not entirely sure the arbitrage is a bad thing. The knowledge of the next ratio is inexact, it gets more accurate the closer you get to the next epoch. Arbers can arb the market, but with some degree of uncertainty. Any outside market should reflect this. So if it's a  1:1000 ratio. Market is 1:1000. As the block progresses you’re increasingly certain it’ll be 1:1100. You go and trade against the outside market until it’s 1:1100. In other words, market forces always adjust the market price vs the treasury (and future treasury) price.
Because there's no ability to _buy_ on this treasury, you can't arb by selling a bunch and then buying later. Or vice versa.

Can someone confirm, if I submit a MOBILE to HNT conversion through the treasury, will I be assigned HNT based on the prior epoch’s closing ratio, or on the ratio at the end of the current epoch that hasn’t closed yet?
As it's currently implement, the prior epoch's closing ratio.
MOBILE is burned and redeemed for HNT in the ratio at prior epoch's closing.
It's always just current mobile supply/current hnt treasury
which is the same as any point within the current epoch as there are no rewards to the treasury in the meantime anyway?
Right.
Ok, I feel like this is the whole problem.  What is the advantage of doing the prior epoch and not the current epoch?
It only changes when, at the end of the epoch: 1. Mobile supply increases to issue rewards. 2. Mobile HNT treasury increases based on utility score.
maybe rather than saying prior epoch closing, we could say "epoch boundary" as defined by ^
if that's cleaner language but it means the same thing
epoch boundaries are when prices can change. because between boundaries, everything is linear.
is it intentional that you can’t drain the treasuries? The 20% circuit breaker essentially puts a floor on the redeem ratio
the circuit breaker is more a technical limiter. it'd be reasonable at some point to adjust with governance as more things are made immutable, imo.
(any limitation has the same affect btw, not just because it is 20%)
It's not clear to me that someone would liquidate a massive amount of their mobile based on the results of the next epoch.
The only arb here is the difference between the market value (i.e on chain dex, etc) and the treasury value. That should equalize itself as the epoch progresses due to market forces and arbitrageurs.
I don't think there's anything _exploitable_ here. And that's my main concern.
my question was unrelated to the arb fwiw, just that the circuit breakers essentially create a floor price when the amount flowing into the treasury will equal the 20% you can take out.

What happens when the ratio in the treasury is better than the current ratio of IOT to HNT being added each day?  At that point, the optimal strategy is for every single person to exchange 100% of their IOT every day they get it?  If only 20% is allowed to, that’s a problem.
gotta go fast I guess
This does seem like an issue.
I think in that case, a dao vote could relax the breakers.

But back to the ratio being used.  I feel strongly it should be the closing ratio of the current epoch, not the previous epoch.  It solves the whole potential arb issue.  The only downside I see is that people won’t have immediate access to the HNT they’re trying to get, and may have to wait up to 24 hours.  But that’s basically how rewards currently work.
you’re looking at the wrong side, HNT to DC burn is the part that is immediate, rewards will always be epoch boundary
It's a big UX issue. Can't integrate with Jupiter aggregator that way either.
Say I’m 5G operator X in dire need for more DC, should I just tell all my customers to wait until epoch boundary before they can 5G again?
Yeah, HNT to DC needs to be be immediate and it is.  But I thought we were talking about MOBILE/IOT to HNT?
Again this is all self-correcting. If there's a large burn of MOBILE, that will cause next epoch's ratio to be better. Because there's more HNT for a smaller share of mobile.
I don’t see the arb without hnt to dc burn, maybe I’m missing it
The burns themselves affect the ratio at the next epoch.
So while there's an arb here, it's actually just normal market forces. Handled easily by a CLOB or even an AMM outside of the treasury.
HNT to DC is based on the price oracles which update more frequently than 24 hours, right?
The price calculation of MOBILE/IOT for the purposes of rewards capping (to prevent arb) will not be done by the treasury price.
Minutes right now, I assume it stays that way
Long-term it will likely be done by a pyth price oracle. Short term, we may need to do something similar to what happens with hnt price on the current chain.
Yeah, that’s good.  But if that was 24 hour periods, that would be a problem.  That’s the issue because MOBILE to HNT shouldn’t be using a potentially 23 hour old ratio.
For rewards calculations, it won't be. Only for treasury redemption. Which was always meant to be a floor price.
There is no MOBILE to HNT using an old ratio?
I feel like I’m hearing two different things.
Can someone exchange MOBILE to HNT using a 23 hour old ratio?
Yes.
it is potentially the same ratio as 23 hours ago, but that doesn’t make it old?
It’s still treasury value vs outstanding dnt?
The very act of them exchanging mobile to HNT does change the future ratio at the epoch boundary, though.
So nothing is certain until exactly the epoch boundary.
So I agree. It's not an old ratio. It's the current ratio.
And the current ratio changes when the epoch ends.
Assuming there is more HNT flowing into the treasury than MOBILE given out
That'll prob always be the case given the denomination differences lol
Yea I meant relatively speaking to the current split
If the ratio of HNT:DNT going into the treasury and being rewarded respectively is higher it will increase, else decrease
A large burn of DNT isn’t necessarily the bad call just because it changes the ratio for next epoch is what I mean

On any given day, the optimal strategy will either be to convert none of your DNT or convert all of your DNT, depending on what ratio is better, the treasury ratio or the daily added ratio.  There would never be an optimal reason to convert some (but not all).
there is never an optimal strategy in which you buy a lottery ticket but people still do
Agree, not everyone will act optimally.  But I think we should be prepared for the situation where everyone SHOULD be converting everything they have every day.  Because that scenario is possible.

The scenario where no one should be converting anything is easier to manage because nobody does anything and if they do, they’re benefiting everyone else who didn’t convert.  But the opposite scenario is trickier to plan for.

Let's do an example. Let's say there's 1000 IOT and 100 HNT in the treasury. 
 
*  10 IOT = 1 HNT
*  At 23 hours, we're pretty sure next epoch, the rewards will be 50 HNT and the emissions will be 600 IOT. 
* Next epoch, if nothing changes, 1600 IOT to 150 HNT = 10.666 IOT = 1 HNT. 
* Someone sees this, and burns 800 IOT for 80 HNT. 
* Treasury at epoch end will now be 800 IOT to 70 HNT = 11.43 IOT = 1 HNT.
This does create somewhat of a downward cycle. Though presumably at some point this sets the ratio so low that the next epoch is bound to increase the ratio.
The circuit breakers already forbid this example
I still think the market will equalize. There's too many moving parts here, too much uncertainty. You're long not just one epoch, but n epochs after.
Just trying to think through economics.
me too, but those circuit breakers at 20% significantly limit market forces from finding that level, at least in the few back of the envelope sims I walked through
Sellers eventually shrink DNT supply such that future epoch's HNT infusions into the treasury look appealing.

Let’s say there’s currently 1000 IOT and 100 HNT, and the next epoch will add 1000 IOT but only 10 HNT.  Everyone will want to convert to get a piece of the 100 HNT, but if there are any circuit breakers then there’s a race to see who can convert first?
I'm open to different values
Keep in mind it's 20% in a 24 hour period, but it's more like a rate limiter. So every second that goes by, more can be exchanged.
That means you can have a continuous 20% per day downpressure.
if you take out the max allowable under any circuit breaker you will end up and some equilibrium where the any% going in equals any% you’re allowed to take out.
Do we really expect that values will need to fluctuate by more than 20% in a day to reach equilibrium?
But what happens when the optimal play is for every single IOT holder to convert 100% of their IOT?
I somehow doubt this is the case. You're talking _years_ of emissions vs _one day_ change in treasury.
Day 1 this might be a big change. But day 300?
I don’t know, but I don’t think you can achieve a scenario in which staying in is more valuable because of a big burn while being limited to 20%
I don't think this will ever be true. Maybe day 1 it looks like there's a huge difference. But at day 400 it's anyone's game as to what will be in the treasury and what supply of IOT there will be
Basically my point is that any example such as the one you gave above will be impossible to get to with the circuit breaker in place
I don’t think this is right.  If MOBILE is on a rising trajectory then one day this will happen to IOT or vice versa.
Ultimately holding a DNT token is a long position on the future value of the treasury, not just one day out. But years out.
True, but if a subdao’s ratio is declining, unless it reverses course then it will never make sense not to convert.
By the time this happens, things will be so stable in value that you shouldn't need 20% treasury burn in a day to reach equilibrium.
the biggest unknown un the whole discussion is that you still need that DNT if you care enough to want to participate in governance of the subDAO
It will be forced to reverse course due to the tokens being burned. Eventually the supply of tokens is lowered to the point where the future treasury HNT value starts to matter again.

I think the missing value here in our calculations is the future value of the treasury. If there's lower DNT tokens in circulation, the future value of the treasury looks more appetizing. This is why the system is self-balancing. The more that gets burned, the better it is for those who stay. Market forces should figure it out, right? Or maybe I'm dumb.
If a subdao’s ratio gets slightly worse every day (which seems totally plausible) then it makes sense to exchange everything you get every single day.
I think eventually you reach some kind of equilibrium. And each subdao has a relatively similar price in terms of HNT on a day to day basis.
If you did that, eventually the subdao's ratio would start to get slightly better each day.
Why would the ratio get better?
As you burn more DNT, supply goes down. Less supply to split future HNT emissions with.
I’m talking about the ratio of what the subdao is earning.
You have to burn DNT to get HNT.
Let’s say the treasury is empty hypothetically.
you’re assuming a constant subDAO score there?
Yeah. I mean if the score for that subdao is also constantly going down, presumably people just don't want to use that network anymore?
or they want to use another network more, but yea, fair
Or some other subdao is growing like crazy.
But that is still a case in which you want to check out everything all the time
Yep. And that's working as designed I think?
is it though? Wanna race me to the circuit breaker? :Troll:
Exactly, there shouldn’t be a race.  That’s a problem.
There will be, the thing resets and the first one to get there has redeemed his DNT for the day
I’ll have to think about it some more, I understand where n_ is coming from but I’m not sure I follow 🙃

I just think we need to be prepared for a situation where everybody should want to convert all the DNT they have every day for potentially weeks or months on end.  It’s a lot more plausible a scenario than people realize I think.
There's no concept of reset on the circuit breaker, it's more of a rate limiter

So imagine a hose that can only fit so much water through it. Only so much HNT can come out a day. It's at 1s granularity. So there isn't a race so much as people sending txns once a second for a tiny amount more. Though that wouldn't be profitable bec of sol fees.
So in practice you can only do 0,000231481481481% per second? Or how does the rate limiter average?
Yes
probably shouldn’t call them circuit breakers then, not sure if I like it more or less this way
this is basically limiting economics by burying you in fees.
some whale will have to claim his rewards in tiny increments every second to not upset the rate limiter
Yeah. So modeling this out, the treasury price tends towards the ratio being emitted each epoch. Because there are pre mines of both IOT and MOBILE, we start off far away from that ratio.

Absent of other incentives to hold a token, once the ratio is achieved, any negative changes in emission ratios due to falling utility scores would cause sell offs. As sell offs occur, the treasury price of the following epoch tends towards the new emission ratio.

Yep.  And with potentially new subdaos being added, it’s possible their emission ratios are the highest they’ll ever be at that point, which means the treasury ratio is the highest it’ll ever be at that point, which means everyone is incentivized to convert 100% of their DNT every single day until the emissions ratio starts to go up again.  Which could be weeks, months, or even longer.
Which is I think fine, at the end of the day these are mining rewards. People can do what they want with them. It's only a problem if it's constantly rate limited.
So I think we probably should start with the 20% rate limit. And if it ends up being legitimately triggered for days at a time, we need to raise the limit

Yeah, thanks to the premines we have some time before this has the potential to become an issue.  So I think keeping a 20% limit makes sense in case something is wrong with the initial implementation.  But I think the plan should be to remove any limits like that completely once we’re confident in the new system. And I would argue we should take it one step further and provide a way for wallets to automatically convert DNT to HNT as soon as it’s received if someone so chooses.  But that’s a discussion for down the road.
the auto convert solution is something i hope to see folks build. that seems like a good wallet feature 🙂
wallet companies could charge for it too.
also other interesting things like: convert to veIOT, convert to veIOT and stake x% against hotspot for an SLA commitment (proto hip idea i threw out in #hip-discussion the other day), etc.
a while ago i spoke to a solana ecosystem team that also talked about automatically emitting to a vault strategy that converted over time.

Can we add something in writing to the HIP that the 20% circuit breaker is a temporary safety mechanism and will be removed once the system is deemed to be stable?  Also, I think the time to remove it will be well before it becomes a problem, not after a few days of it being a problem.

Bind it by an actual timeline thus forcing it to go for an IIP/MIP if it is to be extended. I would say "20% circuit breaker is a temporary safety mechanism and is bound to 120 days after migration to the Solana blockchain. This value can be modified by an IIP/MIP post migration"
This makes me pretty nervous. Some exploits aren't discovered in 120 days. They're discovered years later. Do we really want to lower our backup security on the off-chance there's a large burn-off?

We have 1 day of exchanging at a set rate. I'd rather dictate that a multisig has emergency power to disable the circuit breaker for legitimate use cases. So long as they do it within a day, everyone should get the correct rate.
These smart contracts are also living breathing things. They'll be changing. A change introduced 125 days later now has the full treasury open as an attack surface. Not great.
That sounds like a PR nightmare, the Foundation deciding who is legitimate enough to exceed circuit breaker burn
Legitimate as in this isn't an exploit
Should be pretty obvious to see that the treasury is draining without dnt getting burned. Or dnt getting minted that isn't in accordance with the emissions schedule.
So you would have to plead your case and hope the Foundation has time for your request?
We have tons of alarms triggered by circuit breakers.
And people on pager duty.
A circuit breaker getting triggered is kind of an all hands event. It shouldn't happen.
Some next level reporting and alerting on this seems prudent regardless of the circuit breaker discussion
Yeah, we have dashboards and alerting around this.
I am very paranoid 🙂
good. only the paranoid survive
It's that same paranoia that makes me not want to ever disable the circuit breaker. 20% of the DNT supply getting burned in one day is absolutely massive.
I really don't think that should ever reasonably happen, though we're far from knowing how the economics of this will work in real life.
my (currently) biggest concern is that it isn’t averaging but instead limits on circuit breaker level /86400 per second
I'd much rather see real-life data before making the decision to permanently turn off circuit breaking at some point.
It is averaging. Here I can link to the math, sec
https://github.com/helium/helium-program-library/blob/522cc2a310e96702e229c1569acc166000c16cd9/programs/circuit-breaker/src/window.rs#L37

embeds.description: Helium programs to run on the Solana blockchain. Contribute to helium/helium-program-library development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content: I have no idea whether it is actually limiting in practice though, the economics need to crystallize for that judgement and starting with them in place seems like the right move regardless of potential economic objections
Basically it tries to keep a time-decayed idea of the transfers within the last `n` seconds where `n` is the window size.
So on a fresh breaker, you can transfer 20% in 1 second. It's just that after that 20%, everyone else will be limited x% per second
It only starts rate limiting once you hit the break threshold.
That makes way more sense than how I understood it yesterday

This is the issue right here.  Not only is it likely to happen, it pretty much is guaranteed to happen.  All it takes is a subdao with a consistently declining reward share, which considering it’s a zero-sum game is a certainty if we have more than one subdao.
I assume the rate limiter kicks in on _any_ error code? So also on ArithmeticErrors?
In fact if we have 3 subdaos, chances are 2 of the 3 are in a consistently declining reward share, meaning only the one growing subdao will have any incentive for people to not convert all their DNT.
The one delay to this happening is the honeymoon period from the premines, but that won’t last forever.

Imagine down the road we add a 5th subdao and it comes out of the gate doing really well.  Then the other 4 existing subdaos will all start into a declining rewards trend where their current conversion ratio is the best it will ever be going forward, so all 4 of the other subdaos will be incentivized to convert all their DNT every single day.  That’s just the nature of having a zero-sum pie to reward HNT here.
Assuming there's no other reason to hold the token, which isn't necessarily true.

Very true.  But let’s say the other reason is governance.  Then you’re asking DNT holders to choose between holding DNT for governance reasons or redeeming for their maximum amount of HNT.  In other words, anyone who wants to hold DNT has to pay an opportunity cost in HNT every day to do so.

This entire issue boils down to the scenario of a declining rewards ratio, and specifically when this declining rewards ratio drops below the subdao’s treasury ratio.  But there is a way to solve this on the subdao level, and that’s to peg the rewards ratio to a constant value.  The subdao obviously can’t control the HNT it’s being rewarded, but it can control the DNT being minted.  So all it has to do is peg the DNT created each epoch to the HNT it’s receiving.  Using round numbers as an example, if the IOT subdao receives 25k HNT in the epoch, then it should mint exactly 25 million IOT.  If that drops next epoch to 24k HNT, then it only mints 24M IOT.  This keeps the rewards ratio constant at .001, which means the treasury ratio (which starts out at a lower value because of the premine) will constantly approach .001, but never reach it.  Meaning there will never be a situation where IOT holders are incentivized to convert all their IOT.

I remember @KeithR was bringing this very scenario up a few months ago, but I don’t think it’s been talked about nearly enough.  Instead, it seems like most people believe there will never be a reason to convert a whole bunch of DNT to HNT, and anyone who does is acting sub-optimally.  But that’s simply not true because with the way the subdaos are currently setup, it’s practically guaranteed to happen unless we change something.

Thank you for remembering!
I came to the conclusion that a fixed ratio of emissions makes sense if you expect the subDAO's flywheel to spin up and down rather than only up (and where you practically kill the subDAO if it doesn't spin it upwards).  I am not surprised with myself on that as I tend to stick with something for too long.  Killing a subDAO quickly does seem to be the method of choice for those in the finance world.

The fixed ratio is key if the rewards are declining, but not necessary if your subdao is increasing.  The problem is with a fixed pie, there will always be at least one subdao with declining rewards.  And given the head start in devices and its high starting reward share, the declining subdao is a lot more likely to be the IOT one, rather than MOBILE.  And it’s important to stress that this will be likely to happen even if the IOT network itself starts to take off and is doing really well, simply because of its initial reward scale.  That’s why I think it’s important for IOT to consider changing their minting process to be a fixed reward ratio.
This is an interesting idea, though perhaps it should be another HIP.
I think we have time to deal with this issue given the premines. This HIPs goal is to set the solana parameters correctly, not to govern any kind of economics. I
I don't think the treasury is intended as the primary reason to hold. So there are probably other solutions that involve better incentives around the DNT tokens.

Yep, definitely agree this is a discussion for a later time and a different HIP.  Just wanted to get this thought out there because all things being equal, I think it’s better to not have some subdaos constantly having their treasuries drained.
